what Andy Coulson brought to it. His argument is sufficiently layered to avoid sounding blatantly disloyal. For example, he points out that Mr George Osborne teamed up with Mr Andy Coulson to give Tory policies a harder edge: Inside those circles the toughest minded on those issues is George Osborne which is maybe surprising given that he's richest of them- but he is always the one who wants to go for lower taxes and go for the slight tougher edged, harder edge line and I think Andy Coulson gave him a lot of advantage in that. He brought a second dimension to George Osborne 's arguments and I hope whoever they replace him with will bring the same to the table.
